metadata.feature_description: Tests the Save button element in the UI (currently non-functional placeholder)

steps.action: Navigated to PersonaBar > Accounts section by clicking nav_Accounts menu item
steps.expected: AccountSettings.html content should display with 'Hello World, This is Site Settings.' heading and Save button with class='primarybtn'
steps.actual: The Accounts section displays a 'Users' management panel instead of the AccountSettings.html content. No 'Hello World, This is Site Settings.' text or Save button with class='primarybtn' is visible.

issues:
The AccountSettings.html placeholder content is not rendered in the UI. The code file contains '

Hello World, This is Site Settings.

' and 'Save' but these elements are not visible in the PersonaBar Accounts section.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Check Save button has 'primarybtn' CSS class

steps.action: Searched for Save button with class='primarybtn' in the PersonaBar Accounts section
steps.expected: Save button anchor element with CSS class 'primarybtn' should be present
steps.actual: The Save button from AccountSettings.html is not rendered in the UI. Cannot verify CSS class as the element does not exist in the DOM.

issues: Cannot test CSS class because the Save button element from AccountSettings.html is not present in the UI.

observations:
Code analysis reveals AccountSettings.html contains: '

Hello World, This is Site Settings.

Save
'
The AccountSettings.js file has minimal init/load functions with no click handlers for the Save button, confirming it is a non-functional placeholder as stated in the feature description.

The actual UI at PersonaBar > Accounts displays a fully functional 'Users' management panel with Add User, Remove Deleted Users, user list, and per-user action icons (Profile Settings, Account Settings, User Roles, User Activity).
The per-user 'Account Settings' action opens a user-specific account settings panel with different Save button implementation (button element vs anchor element).
The AccountSettings.html placeholder content appears to never have been integrated into the active UI, making the Save button untestable via UI interaction.
